intro.description: This tutorial guides you through the creation of a simple Event-B project modelling a counter with increment and decrement operations.

item.title: Open the Modeling Perspective
item.description: Select Window->Open Perspective->Modelling in the menubar at the top of the workbench. This step changes the perspective to set up the Eclipse workbench for Event-B modeling.

item.title: Create an Event-B Project
item.description: The first thing you will need is an Event-B Project. If you already have an Event-B project in your workspace that you would like to use, you may skip this step by clicking the "Click to Skip" button. If not, click on the create new project icon on the top of the the Project Explorer on the left hand side of the workbench. Complete the subsequent pages as required.

item.title: Create an Event-B machine
item.description: You should now have an Event-B project in your workspace. The next thing to do is to create a machine called "Counter" in this project. Select the project and click on the create new component wizard at the top of the Project Explorer. Give the component the name "Counter", choose its type as Machine, and click the "Finish" button.

item.title: Add a variable to the machine
item.description: Now add the variable "count" to the machine using the add variable wizard at the top of the workbench. Give it the type NAT, and initialise it to 0.
